fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, even though "Time Tracking" field is added to the issue screen, users can not add or edit "Original Estimate" field in Jira mobile app. Users can only log the work.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be helpful if "Original Estimate" field is editable in Jira mobile app.
fields.summary: Allow to add/edit "Original Estimate" field in Jira mobile

fields.description:
Greetings,

I've attempted to reach out once before, but today we pulled the trigger on setting up a pilot to test feasibility of utilizing some of the Atlassian Applications (Jira Core and Confluence) for construction projects.  Myself and one of my colleagues have experience with (positive to add) with your products before, and felt the Agile workflow management process would fit well into our current field of work in construction.  We would like to talk to someone more about how we could further enhance and align to our processes?  I'll be honest, I don't think it would take much!

Thanks!

Nate

*Nate Wheeler* | Preconstruction Manager- Specialty Systems

o: (715) 997.6868 | m: (715) 432.1598

[Faith Technologies, Inc.|http://www.faithtechnologies.com/]
fields.summary: Leveraging Atlassian Applications in Construction

fields.description: As a user, I would like to view the videos directly from the browser and not download it to view.
fields.summary: Play videos directly from browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary - Issues Types in Agility Projects for show up in Spanish. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
- None

h3. Expected Results.
- Issue Types show up in English

h3. Actual Results 
- Issues Types show in Spanish

h3. Workaround 
- None

h3. Additional Notes
- This does not affect all customers and is only happening for a small subset of customers.
fields.summary: Issue Types showing in Spanish for Agility projects

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a software project
# Use the New JIRA Issue View 
# Create an issue
# Try to change the Issue's Status from the issue detail view within the Right side panel (active sprint or backlog)
# the Issue details view goes blank and the popup "something went wrong" appears
# Reload the page, the board load and the issue status is updated.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-25 at 14.15.41.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-25 at 14.15.51.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-25 at 14.16.00.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected :*
The status is updated and the issue detail view stay opened without error

*Actual:*
The Right Side panel is blank and the error is thrown

On the Active sprint board if the issue status is updated from the centered issue details view (instead of the Right side panel view) the issue status is updated and no message is thrown but you need to refresh the page to be able to continue to open issue detail views. 


*Expected*
We can continue to view other issues details

*Actual:*
Have to refresh the board to continue opening issue details view



*Workaround:*
-Turn off the New JIRA Issue View in the user's profile lab section.
-Update the status outside of the board
-Refresh the page to continue

+The error:+
Nothing in Splunk.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-25 at 14.24.26.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem description: 
 * When performing a REST call to */rest/api/2/mypermissions* to a particular issue, the call will return an *Internal Server Error* if the issue's status contains the workflow property *jira.permissions.\**.

h3. How to reproduce:
 # Perform a GET request to the /rest/api/2/mypermissions endpoint, defining a specific issue key using the *issueKey* parameter:
{code}
curl -D- -u <emailAddress>:<apiToken> -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/mypermissions?issueKey=<issueKey>
{code}

h3. Expected result:
 # Response should be a 200, returning the user's permissions for that issue.

h3. Actual result:
 * Internal server error (500) is returned:
{code}
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Server: Atlassian Proxy/0.1.285

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
Admins are not able to see all their Projects and members that have access to each of these projects. If they had this option, this would be very useful to check if all users have the correct access to their projects.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability, for admins, to see all Projects and respective users with access to each of them.

h2. Why this is important
To enhance the admin experience, allowing them to have better control over their Projects, and also help them to save a lot of time, seeing all Projects and respective users with access in one page, instead of checking one by one.
fields.summary: Ability to see all Spaces and respective users with access to each of these projects

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the language setting to Japanese
# Navigate to Export Issue menu

h3. Expected Results
User can see the export option

h3. Actual Results
The menu is too narrow and user is unable to see the full contents.
Most of the contents in the brackets are omitted.
 !スクリーンショット 2018-07-25 17.04.39.png|thumbnail!  !スクリーンショット 2018-07-25 17.05.02.png|thumbnail! 
This is affecting bad because user can't decide the difference of each options

h3. Note
Changing the browser window size or font size won't fix this problem.
 
h3.Workaround
Change language setting to English
fields.summary: Can't read the full options for localized contents in Export Issue menu

fields.description:
For example an Agility Project named "Next\Main1" is created. 
Then you won't be able to open the project settings as the project details page fails to load. 

The character next after the "\"  within the name's string is an unexpected character, causing a JSON unexpected token error and generating a Javascript error: "TypeError: Cannot read property 'props' of undefined" from the react-dom js module.
  
The Agility Project named "Next\Main1" contains a "\" character at the position 5 of the project name's string, loading the project settings will thrown:
- Error parsing data with key project-name: SyntaxError: Unexpected token M in JSON at position 6
- react-dom.production.min.js:187 TypeError: Cannot read property 'props' of undefined
    at translate-message.js:34
    at mapValues.js:38
    at _createBaseFor.js:17
    at e.exports (_baseForOwn.js:13)
    at e.exports (mapValues.js:37)
    at translate-message.js:28
    at Pn (react-dom.production.min.js:172)
    at ls (react-dom.production.min.js:201)
    at cs (react-dom.production.min.js:202)
    at Ks (react-dom.production.min.js:211)

The UI will show a blank page with the popup "Something's gone wrong"
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-24 at 15.14.03.png|thumbnail! 
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an Agility Template's project with an "\" within the project name.
# Open the setting page (e.g URL https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/pkey/settings/details)

*Expected*:
To load the project settings and details page

*Actual*:
Blank page with pop up "something's gone wrong.... reload the page" (reloading is still the same)

*Workaround*:
# Create a new agility project without the "\" within the name.
# Move the issues to that new project
# Delete the corrupted project
fields.summary: Agility Template Bug: Project details page fails to load if there is an "\" within the project name

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The compact view settings for Jira - Slack integration is not respected for subscriptions related to comments. 
 !Screenshot_27.png|thumbnail!
h2. How to reproduce
 # Select the compact view from the Jira - Slack setting page.
 # Make a comment on an issue

h3. Expected behaviour

The comment made appears in a compact view (i.e. only issue key / summary in message attachment).
h3. Actual results

The comment made appears in the message attachment, below the issue key / summary.
 !Screenshot_26.png|thumbnail!
h2. Workaround

There is no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Slack integration - compact view isn't applied for comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some processes (especially those used in companies that are agency regulated) require username/password to be entered when performing certain tasks, such as transitioning an issue through workflow. Some systems support this already (Seapine Test Track Pro comes to mind), and it would be nice if JIRA did as well. Perhaps the solution could be adding a username/password type of field to workflow transitions.
h3. Environment

Cloud environment
h3. Expected Results

FDA Part 11 compliance
h3. Actual Results

Jira and Confluence are not compliant out-of-the-box.
h3. Notes

For the server environment there are various add-ons:
 # *Comalatech* using [Comala Workflows|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.comalatech.workflow/server/overview?_ga=2.159191992.305044981.1512995098-1827667113.1507731271] - [support contact|https://comalatech.zendesk.com/hc/en-us].
 # *AppFusion* also provides through the Atlassian marketplace the [CFR Part 11 E-Signatures (FDA Compliance) for Atlassian JIRA|https://www.appfusions.com/display/PRT11J/Home] that adds an e-signature JIRA field and audit reporting to your workflow.
 # *InLabs* also provides [Electronic Signature plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.intenso.jira.plugins.cfr.electronic-signature/server/overview] to meet CFR Part 11.

h3. Workaround:

There exist other apps in Marketplace that offer this. You can search Marketplace for these by searching the term [CFR Part 11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=jira&query=cfr%20part%2011].
fields.summary: FDA Part 11 compliance - Support for electronic signatures

Some users are not satisfied with the paging and would like to have a way to show all the projects on the same page.

h3. Summary
Accessing an issue collector form directly through the URL shows a blank page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue collector using a *Custom* template.
# While editing the issue collector, get its ID in the URL.
# Access the issue collector directly using the following URL: {code}https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/rest/collectors/1.0/template/form/<ISSUE COLLECTOR ID>{code}
# These steps are based in this article:
- [How to Access Issue Collector Form without Embedding it in a Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-access-issue-collector-form-without-embedding-it-in-a-page-826872619.html?_ga=2.121503496.1894725997.1532366143-679363520.1532116124]

h3. Expected Results
The above-mentioned article was meant to be used in Jira Server, therefore it shouldn't work. However, using a *Raise bug* or *Got feedback?* the form is correctly rendered:
 !issue-collector-form.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The URL shows a blank page when using the Custom form:
 !issue-collector-blank.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
As it is mentioned in the article these instructions are not meant to be used in the Cloud environment due to restricted functions, but they work partially.

h3.Workaround
None.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Based on the [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-IssueIssuekey], the "id" field reference supports these operators:
 - >
 - >=
 - <
 - <=

This works as expected when specifying a valid issue id. For example, searching for "id < 10005" will correctly return issues with issue ids 10004, 10003, 10002, etc (if they exist).

However, when using this operator, and specifying an *invalid* issue id (issue id does not exist), it is expected that the JQL should return the results, even though the specified issue id does not exist, instead of the search completely failing and returning no results. (Read "Steps to Reproduce" for more detailed information)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to issue navigator.
 # Type in this query:
{code:java}
id < 12345
{code}

– Note: this issue id shouldn't refer to an existing issue id in the instance. If it does, change it to something else.
h3. Expected Results

The JQL should return all issues with issue ids less than 12345. For example, 12344, 12343, etc.
h3. Actual Results

The search fails, and this error message is returned:
{quote}A value with ID '12345' does not exist for the field 'id'.
{quote}
h3. Notes

Also affects the REST API endpoint "GET /rest/api/2/search?jql". A "400 Bad Request" error will be returned.
h3. Workaround

Rather than comparing with non-existing id find out the existing id where comparison would bring the same results. E.g. having ids of {{1}}, {{5}} and {{10}}, and intention to run jql {{id < 4}}, find the next id value of existing issue ({{5}} in this case) and rewrite the jql to {{id < 5}}.
fields.summary: In JQL, when using "more than" (>) or "less than" (<) with the "id" field reference with an invalid issue id, the search will fail

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When assigning a screen having the Linked Issues filed to a transition while filling the screen the search for linked issues will only return a search based on your recent history meaning that you will not be able to find certain issues by their summary or description if you haven't seen them for a while.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project.
# Create a screen with the Linked Issues field.
# Edit the project workflow and associate the created screen with a transition.
# Create a test issue and pass it through the transition.

h3. Expected Results

The issue search of the Linked Issues field should work the same way as when going through the link issues functionality and show the current search results as well:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-23 at 17.00.48.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The screen search only runs the search at the history level:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-23 at 16.54.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Note the issue key before running the transition or simply use the link issues functionality.
fields.summary: Linking issues in transition screen

fields.description:
h2. Summary
On create issue dialog when pasting screenshot (or file) from clipboard to description field it is possible to create the issue creation before upload completion, but only the text that refers to an image is inserted but no actual file is attached to issue.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create issue
# Paste attachments from clipboard
# It displays that the image has been attached but the upload progress bar doesn't show up and doesn't block as it's in progress
# Issue is created and the error that Unable to render embedded object file is displayed

Video:
https://cl.ly/3O2t3r3k3Z2j

h2. Suggested Solutions
It should upload the attachments and block the issue creation while the upload progress doesn't finish and display it on the description as a thumbnail.

Also, the progress bar should be closer to the description field, to make it visible when you paste an attachment on the field
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want Jira to warn me before creating an issue with upload in progress

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

With the [removal of the usernames|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], username should no longer be a point of reference for CSV import.
The CSV importer still refers back to username to map to the Assignee field.

h2. Steps to Replicate

# Create a test csv import with the assignee field
# Use user email to map to the assignee

h2. Expected Result

As mentioned, username should no longer applicable, hence the import should succeed with Assignee value mapped to the email address

h2. Actual Result

The mapping still refers to username instead of email address,
!importcsv.png|thumbnail!
Running import returns error:
{noformat}
issue can't be created due to the error/s user does not exist
{noformat}

h2. Workaround
As an alternative way to get user name for the affected user, 
# As a site admin, launch a browser and access the URL : https://<yoursite>/rest/api/3/user/search?query=<User_Email_Address>
# The username information will be returned on the self url.  !username.png|thumbnail! 
# Extract this information and replace the email address with the username in the CSV file
fields.summary: Change CSV import method to map Assignee field to email address

None

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 2 September 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your patience while we investigate this issue.

Our investigation discovered a high degree of complexity to enable rich text support for single line custom fields. The team with the expertise required to do this work, is currently working on a range of performance improvements. Since the usage of single line text fields is low, we’ve decided to prioritise performance improvements (which impacts more people). As a result, we have decided not to support rich text (either wiki markup or markdown) in single line custom fields in the new issue view. We do however have other custom fields that offer rich text (more details below). We will make some minor changes to make this clear in the product.

*What we will be changing*

We will rollout the following changes over the next week:
 * “Text Field (Single Line)” will be renamed to “Short text (plain text only)”
 * “Text Field (Multi-Line)” will be renamed to “Paragraph (supports rich text)”
 * We will also introduce text wrapping for single line custom fields (currently, text will truncate when a character limit is reached)

*Other custom fields available*

There are two other custom fields we recommend using if rich text is required in the new issue view:
 * “URL Field” - if all you need is to display a web URL as a hyperlink.
 * “Paragraph” (formerly Text Field (multi line)) - if you want more rich text functionality, including links to URLs, styling text with bold, colour and/or italics, or anything else available in the Atlassian editor.

The above fields can also be used for automations and ecosystem apps and will support rich text available through markdown. 

We acknowledge that the above changes will require some of you to spend time and effort re-configuring your project/s and we do apologise for this inconvenience caused.

As this issue refers specifically to the support of wiki markup, we will be closing this ticket. The decision was made a number of years ago to replace wiki markup with full markdown support. You can refer to our public comms on this [here|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/jira-cloud-new-issue-view-editor-changes/29993]

Thanks
 The Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
 
h3. Summary

When creating a custom field, regardless of what is configured it uses the Default Text Renderer in Bento.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single line custom field 
 # Set the renderer to Wiki Style and add the field to a Screen

h3. Expected Results

The formatting is rendered
h3. Actual Results

The format is not rendered and the contents of the field are displayed in the Default text
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Wiki Style Renderer does not work for custom Single Line Text fields

fields.description:
Years of customer feedback about complexity and usability problems motivated us to make this change. We engaged with many customers, analyzed a lot of data, and realized that a steep learning curve prevents teams from getting the most out of Jira.

We're changing this by making Jira more intuitive and easier to use. In the new experience, you'll find:
 * A quicker way to view and create shortcuts to your most relevant work.

 * An improved search that helps you find exactly what you’re looking for.
 * A stronger relationship between projects and boards to help you better manage many work streams. 

As you use the new Jira, please give us feedback so that we can keep improving your experience.
----
h2. {color:#00875a}*Login to your Atlassian Account and leave a comment below to give us your feedback. Thanks in advance 😊*{color}
fields.summary: Feedback on the New Jira Experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

With the recent changes, clicking any project from Project settings redirect to Open Issues of the selected project. In the past, this would redirect to project configuration page.
* https://<instance URL>/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa -> https://<Cloud URL>/browse/<project key>

This is the same behavior when users navigate to:
* https://<Cloud URL>/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa

The problem is when users (even they has admin permission) click from the project in Jira Settings, will be seeing "The project isn't available" message if they don't have Browse Project permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*  Open JIRA Dashboard > JIRA Settings > Projects > Projects > select one of the projects 

h3. Expected Result
* Redirect to https://<Cloud URL>/secure/project/EditProject!default.jspa?pid=<project ID>

h3. Actual Result
* It will redirect to https://<Cloud URL>/browse/<project key>

h3. Workaround
* In project Settings, click ( ... ) > Project Settings
* Grant yourself with Browse Project permission
fields.summary: Clicking any project from Project settings redirect to Open Issues of the selected project

h4. Current scenario
!image.png|thumbnail!

h4. Suggested scenario
!image1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change the 'Product Access' button text to 'License usage'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The REST API [Get my permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-mypermissions-get] fails when the issue passed is in a specific workflow step with a {{jira.permission.create.clone.denied}} property.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a workflow
# In one status set the 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied' property to 'true'
# Publish the workflow
# Find an issue in that status
# Invoke 'Clone' on it
# You should see a message that cloning is forbidden (expected behavior)
# Call GET /rest/api/2/mypermissions?issueKey=ABC-1
# You'll get a status 500

h3. Expected Results
Status 200 and the corresponding permissions

h3. Actual Results
Status 500
{noformat}
{
    "message": "Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml",
    "status-code": 500,
    "stack-trace": "java.lang.RuntimeException: Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml\n\tat com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:182)\n\tat com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:119)\n\tat com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:212)\n\t
...
}
{noformat}
fields.summary: HTTP 500 error when calling /mypermissions endpoint

 * Perhaps in future, an alert to ask when trying to move a ticket to a specified column, eg, "Ready for Test", "Not all checkboxes have been checked? Are you sure you want to move this ticket?"

fields.description:
I want to create a custom field for "Content Type" that is of field type: checkboxes. When people select their content type, I would like to run a post function in my workflow to assign a component. So, for example, if content types "Digital Ad" or "Print Ad" are selected, I would like the post function to select the component "Advertising"

 

Steps:
 * Create custom field called "Content Type" of field type "checkboxes"
 * Create a post-function that assigns the issue to a specific component based on a mapping of each content type to an existing component
fields.summary: post function to map certain custom field values to a single field

fields.description:
I have a project to track marketing requests. I would like to be able to create a new task/issue and assign a due date for each stage/transition. So the "to-do" due date would be before the "approval" due date, which would be before the "publish" due date, for example. 

 

Steps:
 # Crate task/issue
 # Assign due date for first transition/status (e.g. "To-Do")
 # Assign due date for second transition/status (e.g. "Approve")
 # Assign due date for final transition/status (e.g. "Publish")
fields.summary: Multiple Due Dates on an issue based on transition

fields.description:
When Exporting a search or filter to CSV, including the "Key" field in the export will also include the Issue ID and the Parent ID.

Because the issue ID and Parent ID are not always needed or useful when using CSV exports for reporting purposes, and it can cause issues when lining up data in certain environments, it would be useful if the option to specify that it not be included in the CSV is included.

To this end, I would like to propose that a third export to CSV option be created to allow for *explicit* selection of which fields to export rather than rely on the current view as this is not immediately apparent to users what fields they have selected as it is common for them not to take an active role in selecting specific values.
fields.summary: Allow users to hide Issue ID and Parent ID fields while including issue key when exporting filter to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Available Streams' option in the Activity Stream gadget is missing in certain instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Activity Stream gadget in a Jira dashboard.
# Edit the gadget in order to see the possible options.

h3. Expected Results
The *Available Streams* option to filter only Jira or Confluence activity should be available:
 !activity-stream-settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
In some instances there is no such option:
 !activity-stream-no-streams.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Since there is no option to select only Jira or Confluence activity, both are displayed by default in the gadget.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround. Please raise a support request at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] and mention reference this ticket.
fields.summary: The 'Available Streams' option in the Activity Stream gadget is missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time tracking report is showing two different behaviors when handling issues that have 0 time spent but do have a value in the original estimate. This is causing a difference between the actual sum of the individual accuracy values and the *total accuracy*  provided by the report:

* Individually: it considers accuracy = 0  if the issue has no time spent but still has an original estimate (usually this would be negative by the formula)

* In the total row:  it applies the formula using the total of the variables (total original estimate - (total "timespent"  + total remaining estimate)), this causes the original estimate for issues that had 'timespent'  = 0 to bring differences to what you see in the total accuracy provided by Jira, and the actual sum of all rows (done manually).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issues as the following
## one with values in the original estimate and 'timespent'
## One with values in the original estimate and *no values for 'timespent'*
# Extract a time tracking report

h3. Expected Results
* When you sum up all the rows of the accuracy column, it should have the same result as the *Total Accuracy* provided by Jira.

h3. Actual Results
* When you sum the accuracy column, it has a different value from the total Accuracy
fields.summary: Accuracy in the time tracking report is having two different behaviors for the Total and individual values

fields.description:
It would be handy to have a report available in Jira/Confluence which can provide information about for how long a particular user has been active in a cloud application. It would be even better if the report can include information like the pages they viewed/worked on, the issues they worked on etc.

It can help site admins see which users are using Jira/Confluence more and use this information for estimating the actual number of licenses needed.

Currently, cloud applications only tell when a user was last active. Another option is to export users on check who logged in last when but it is not very practical for reporting purposes.
fields.summary: User activity report in cloud applications

fields.description:
When trying to simplify the configuration of a Jira instance, it is often restrictively difficult to do so because of Project specific configuration for System Fields (such as the resolution field) which requires configuration at the workflow level. This adds un-needed complexity where similar or identical workflows would otherwise work.

I would like to suggest extending the Custom Field Context functionality to System fields that would otherwise be configured through workflow-level configuration.
fields.summary: Allow Field Contexts for System Fields

fields.description:
As described in the documentation [Manage your Jira personal settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/manage-your-jira-personal-settings-952074144.html], the Autowatch setting is only applied whenever a user *creates a new issue* or *comments in an existing one*.
{quote}
*Autowatch* – With autowatch on, you become a watcher of any issue that you create or comment on. This means you'll get an email when someone updates or comments on the issue
{quote}

However, this could also be applied when performing other operations, such as:
 * Editing an issue
 * Being mentioned on an issue
 * Transitioning an issue
fields.summary: "Autowatch" configuration applied to more actions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Resolve this issue" translation is incorrect when setting the language to Russian.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check if the "Resolve this issue" has the default properties:
 ## Key: jira.i18n.title
 ## Value: sd.workflow.itsupport.v2.transition.resolve.this.issue.title
 # Change the profile/system language to Russian.
 # Check a ticket that has a workflow with the transition "Resolve this issue".

h3. Expected Results

The button shows the translation Решить эту проблему. According to [https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/translate?lang=ru_RU#/0/0/All%20Groups/ACCEPTED_TRANSLATIONS/resolve.this.issue]
h3. Actual Results

The translation for "Resolve this issue" shows Обработать данную задачу (Edit this task/issue).
fields.summary: "Resolve this issue" translation is incorrect when setting the language to Russian

fields.description:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
 - Edit others time estimates
 - Add/Edit own time estimates
 - View time estimates

 # The agency wants to be able to control who can see any time estimation and tracking information, such as customers (likely not), internal project management (rather yes) etc.
 # In some circumstances, this information is sensitive and needs to be handled accordingly.
fields.summary: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes there might be needed to grant edit permission to some users only for one specific custom field, not for the whole issue.

h3. Suggested Solutions
It would be great to have a text custom field where we can set the edit permission differently from what is set on the permission scheme.
fields.summary: Create a custom field with an edit permission apart from what is set on the permission scheme.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When issue view is set to "Detail View", no prompt to save during edit of description when you click on a filter link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set issue view to "Detail View"
# Open one of the ticket in "Browse" mode by clicking on the Issue Key
#* It will be opened in a URL similar to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-1
# Edit description of the ticket
# Under "Issues and Filters" menu, click on any of the filter
# You will be redirected without any prompt to save first

h3. Expected Results
There should be a prompt to save first. Looks like:
{quote}
Changes that you made may not be saved.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
There is no prompt to save first
 
h3. Notes
* When you're editing comment, it actually prompted:
** "You have entered a comment on this issue. If you navigate away from this page without first saving, the comment will be lost."
* When you're editing description and click on a button that redirected to any other link which is not a filter, it actually prompted:
** "Changes that you made may not be saved."

h3.Workaround
Use "list view" mode in the issue view
fields.summary: When issue view is set to "Detail View", no prompt when getting redirected to another page during editing

fields.description:
I would like to be able to set a custom field, with a value that is somewhat related to or comprised of the value in another custom field.

On the transition, I have set a screen to capture a Ticket Number in a seperate system. Then, I would like to take that ticket number, and apply a url infront of it, which would be stored in another custom field.

Essentially, In the transition I was trying to set a custom field value to https://<myurl>/tickets/[10065], hoping to get https://<myurl>/tickets/465

 

This would allow somebody to just click on the link on their Jira Issue and have it take them automatically to the other system.
fields.summary: Enable cf[] values to be used in Post Transition 'Update Custom Field Value'

fields.description: It would be very useful if Jira users can find out (without going into the history of each issue) how much time an issue (or issues) spent in any particular status. For instance, if Service Desk admin wants to know how long on average tickets are spending in *Waiting for support* status.
fields.summary: reporting on change history - Calculation of time spent in a particular status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the project > issues and filters there isn't an option to create new filters and the default filters, if try to edit them redirects the user to the instance issue and filters, losing the project reference.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Users would like to create filters inside the project and not use the quick filters at the board. Also, would like to run these custom filters without being redirected from the project page.

This also would be helpful in software projects that doesn't have boards (created by shared configurations) and will not have boards.

h3. Suggested Solutions

Create an option that allow to create filters inside the _issue and filters_ at the project and allow to run these filters without being redirected outside of the project. The quick filter is only applicable at the board.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to be able to create custom filters inside issue and filters at the project

fields.description:
Some add-ons might use that email account to create a user within a Atlassian instance. The current display name for that account is only 'G':
!image.png|thumbnail!

I would like to have that display name for a more meaningful one.
fields.summary: Change jiraconnectuser@connect.jira.com Atlassian Account display name.

fields.description:
Currently when a new instance signs up certain named components (for example “System dashboard”) get a names in English even if the user has chosen another language.

It would be great if a user can choose the locale in which the Jira instance is provisioned.
fields.summary: Assign geotags during provisioning

fields.description:
As a user, if I have made changes to the ticket description by clicking the inline edit pencil I would like to be warned when pressing escape to discard those changes.

This would prevent losing significant work if the user presses escape accidentally.

The user should only be warned like this when editing the description field, not when editing smaller fields like the assigned user, or epic link etc - It would be annoying to warn for small changes but beneficial to warn when discarding potentially very large changes to the description.
fields.summary: Warn the user before discarding changes to a ticket description

fields.description:
We have a need to clear a set of fields when a ticket is cloned.  At this time only a small number of fields are cleared per standard Jira.  This causes hardship in our reporting because data in certain fields is irrelevant to the cloned ticket at that time. 

An example is our date fields.  We auto-populate Close Date when a ticket is Closed and Rejected Date when a ticket is Rejected.  When a ticket is new and cloned this does not make sense to move over.  Furthermore, those fields are not editable by end users so they are just stuck there.
fields.summary: Ability to Clear Fields when tickets are Cloned

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using the original "Export to Excel" functionality, ticket assignee/reporters were exported using the display name (e.g., *Jane Doe*) rather than the username (e.g., *jdoe823*). Now when exporting to CSV, these fields are coming across as username/email.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to allow users (or administrators) to choose whether they'd like the export file to user display name or username. If this proves not to be feasible as it might break compatibility of the exported CSV data with CSV import,  then as an alternative approach provide an option to export display name *as well as* username.
h3. Why this is important

Many organizations have established reporting built around the data originally included within Excel exports. Allowing users to choose how assignees/reporters are displayed will allow them to use existing workflows without modification.

h3. Hint/suggestion

Understanding that you might want to use the CSV file for reporting purposes, which would probably require the actual name of the assignee and reporter, I thought about a possible approach that will help you to keep track of those information.

This example covers the assignee field:
* Create a text custom field:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 09.54.55.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 09.55.09.png|thumbnail! 
* Create an automation within the projects that will populate that custom field with the display name of the assignee when the field Assignee changes (you will need to use the smart value *{{{{issue.assignee.displayName}}}}*):
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 09.56.46.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 09.58.33.png|thumbnail! 
* When search for that field, you can include the text custom field (or export all fields), which will display the assignee's name. That value will be kept when the CSV file is generated:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 09.59.47.png|thumbnail! 

You can implement a similar approach to the reporter fields as well. 

For reference about smart values in Automation, see [Smart values - general|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/].

I understand that it might require some work, but that will automate the operation, and will help with keeping track of the assignee and reporter when exporting issues to CSV.
fields.summary: As a user, I want more control over how CSV export displays assignee/reporter names

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Chrome after downloading attachments from *'New Jira issue view*, the page gets unresponsive with infinite errors in browser's console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software project with Scrum board.
# Add a sprint.
# Create a new issue. Upload an attachment and add the issue to the sprint.
# Start the sprint.
# Ensure _New Jira issue view_ is enabled (in profile). Click on the issue in _Active Sprints_ page (issue will be appeared in _New Jira issue view_ popup screen).
# Click on the attachment. Attachment will be previewed/displayed.
# Click on *Download* button or icon to download the attachment (Attachment will be downloaded in a new tab, and the new tab will be automatically closed afterwards).

h3. Expected Results
Once the attachment has been downloaded, you can see attachment display/preview dialog, and everything works fine.

h3. Actual Results
Once the attachment has been downloaded, the page gets unresponsive and there are infinite following errors in browser's console:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:1996 Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded.
    at FocusManager._focusHandler (com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:1996)
    at t.focusOn (setFocus.js:15)
    at t.default (setFocus.js:25)
    at p (Trap.js:63)
    at HTMLDocument.m (Trap.js:74)
    at Object.trigger (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:118)
    at HTMLDivElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:133)
    at Function.each (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:70)
    at init.each (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:63)
    at init.trigger (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&locale=en-US:133)
{noformat}
 !Download attachment errors.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
* Use a different browser (e.g Mozilla Firefox)
* Disable *New Jira issue view* in your profile/personal settings
fields.summary: Page gets unresponsive when download attachment in 'New Jira issue view'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some gadgets appear with a white background on the Wallboard, notably the *Issue statistics* gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an *Issue statistics* gadget to your Dashboard
# View in Wallboard mode

h3. Expected Results
All gadgets appear in black, blending in with the "Darkmode"

h3. Actual Results
The *Issue statistics* gadget appears white whereas the other gadgets are black.
 !wallboard.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Currently no workaround available.
fields.summary: Some gadgets appear white on the Wallboard

fields.description:
As a user, it would be great to have the ability to add the Last Comment and Last User Updated Comment to the issue filter gadget so that this can be viewed in the dashboard

This would allow users to easily view the last comment made on issues without having to go to the issues.
fields.summary: Allow to add Last Comment and Last User Updated Comment column to the issue filter gadget

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
This  is already tracked in:
 - [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-1510]
 - [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-1497]
 - [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-1511]

For further details on how the username change is going to impact the REST API endpoints please review:
 - [Major changes to Atlassian Connect APIs are coming to improve user privacy|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/api-changes-for-user-privacy-announcement-connect/]
 - [Important notice: Upcoming changes to Jira Cloud REST APIs to improve user privacy|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/api-changes-for-user-privacy-announcement/]

In case of further questions, in the latter link you have a list of links to all the tickets open to track changes to the different REST API endpoints. You can add comments, watch and follow those tickets in order to get updates.
{panel}
Knowing that the [username field will be removed from Atlassian Cloud sites|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], some REST API functions and fields will be directly affected by this change, such as the *user_key* field.

This field is used by many third-party add-ons which might cause some incorrect assumptions since this field can have any value (not exactly related to that user). For example my user is jnunes and my user key can be *skjhude123*.
fields.summary: Improve REST API's for Jira Cloud after username field removal.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We use external systems that get some user's information from Jira based on the username. For example, instead of jnunes the username is QWERS23 for his rest API calls. But know that [usernames will be removed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud] for external methods, we would like to have this field. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
We need is a field on Jira related to the user where we can store de external id and then use it on our script as we use to do.

h3. Current solution
Adapt external systems to use the user email address as the unique id for Jira Applications. Knowing that [Atlassian accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-admins-873871203.html] is based on the email (each user is related to a unique email address), so that is the recommended solution.
fields.summary: Create a field on Jira related to the user as a customisable external id.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes, the reason for an issue not being displayed in Portfolio is not clear. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add a helper, like the *Where is my field?* from Jira to help Portfolio users to understand why the issue is not being shown.
fields.summary: Add to Portfolio a 'Issue helper' button.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a custom field is first given a value on a screen it should show more of the list on the screen. When using the "." _Custom Field name_, pop up it shows only 2-3 entries before the user needs to scroll down to see the other entries. This is not a nice UI experience.


h3. Suggested Solution
For the custom field pop window for the value to be added for the first time, please allow a bigger window to display more of the user picker list.

h3. Workaround
Use the scroll bar.
fields.summary: Display more of the list of users in user picker field custom field when first used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira sends notifications to Slack for a transition that is not selected if that transition has an "assign" post-function

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud, Slack

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Configure an integration between Jira Cloud and Slack. Have Jira send notifications to Slack only for certain transitions, not all. For one of the not-selected transition, add an "assign" post function.

h3. Expected Results
Jira would send notification that the issue has been assigned when the transition is performed

h3. Actual Results
Jira sends notifications for both events: The transition and the assignment.

h3.Workaround
none available
fields.summary: Jira sends Slack notification for unselected transition if "assign" post-function is added to transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating an issue with security level will not send any notification to the linked Slack channel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Slack to a project
# Create *Issue Security Level*
# Create issue with a *Security level*

h3. Expected Results
* If the user has permission to view it, the notification should be sent to Slack.

h3. Actual Results
* No notification sent to Slack, even though the user and Slack(add-on user) is part of the *Security Level*
fields.summary: Slack notification will not trigger when there's a security level

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The option to restrict comment in Issue Detail View isn't available and it's causing users not able to restrict comment directly from the board.

h3, Steps to Reproduce

# Have a Kanban Board and some issues
# Click one of the issues which will open up Issue Detail View pop up
# Attempt to add comment

h3. Actual Result

The option is not available.
-  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

The option is shown.
-  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Open the issue in View Issue and users should be able to see it.
fields.summary: Unable to restrict comment in new UI of Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the growing importance of user privacy (i.e. [GDPR|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/atlassian-and-gdpr-our-commitment-to-data-privacy?_ga=2.218103070.985016089.1531161345-1830511091.1527259164] agreement), I would like to be able to disable de email information display from Jira system for no Site/Jira administrators. 
Currently, the email is displayed when we are mentioning a person in a comment of other kinds of textbox field or when assigning an issue to a user. Knowing that some user might be external from my company, I believe this might be a security breach.
h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature on Jira Administration section to disable that from the rest of the application. That way, the email information will only be displayed in the User section at Jira Administration.
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator, I want to be able to disable the email display.

fields.description:
Please, create an option to search issues updated by a user during a specific time period, or at least add a search field "last updated by".

Specifically, I would like to have a way to easy list all the issues I've been working on lately (e.g. during the last 1 or 7 days).
fields.summary: An option to search issues updated by a user during a specific time period

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users have lots of archived projects, it can make the browse projects page cluttered with old projects
h3. Suggested Solution

To have the ability to select a default value for the *All Categories* drop-down field so when user's visit the *Browse Project* page, they will see the projects in the selected category instead of all categories by default

 !activecat.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Why this is important

It will save the user's time instead of having to select a category each time they visit the browse projects page.
h3. Workaround

Manually set the category each time you visit browse projects page.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the ability to select a default value for the All Categories dropdown field

fields.description:
For the page {{https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/}}.

We would request to update the page with a context to say and vise versa for server version as well:

the HTTP Responses of JIRA Cloud REST API differs from the responses of JIRA Server REST API.

Context:

the REST API Call made for creating meta is the same for JIRA cloud and JIRA server

{{/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta}}

So people expected that the responses return from this API may be the same.
But actually, it does not.

So having a context saying in both documentations 

{{https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/rest-apis/}}

{{{https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/}}

that the responses return may be slightly different would have a clearer picture for users who wants to use the API.
fields.summary: Update https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/ with distinction of different responses from server and cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For Time tracking Report, the timing of the actual time estimate logged in UI does not match with the downloaded version of excel.

When clicking on "Excel view" for "time tracking report", the timing is converted to minutes[default], and even when it has been converted to minutes, the minutes do not get accumulated to the correct amount of hours or days spent.

For example, for an issue, the log time is 4 days, but when downloaded in excel report, the minutes get converted to 1920 minutes which translates to 1.3 days only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to a project

2. Create an issue 

3. Log work with a substantial amount (i.e 4d)

4. Navigate back to reports page and click on time tracking report

5. Ensure that "issues" is all.

6. Once report is created, click on excel view and download the report

7. Search for the issue key that was created and see if the initial log work is there and match to see what is the actual amount of days is accumulated to


h3. Expected Results
The number of minutes accumulated should be the same as the days that have been logged


h3. Actual Results
The number of minutes gets accumulated only to 1.3 days instead of 4 days

h3.Workaround
No workaround yet
fields.summary: Actual time estimate in Time tracking report does not match when downloaded with Excel view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are facing issues when it comes to bolding words in the Description field of the new Issue Detail View

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the Labs function is being turned on in your instance
 # Head over to profile > Labs (bottom of the page) > switch on the option
 # Now head over to any project > head to backlog > select an issue > type anything in the description field eg. *hello*
 # hello would be in Italic _hello or_ hello

!bug1.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The typed word hello will be in bold form

  !bug 2.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The word hello will be in Italic or sometimes the word won't even be processed to bold
h3. Workaround

Turn off the new Issue Detail View
 # 
 ** Go to profile > Labs > Turn off the switch option
fields.summary: Unable to bold words in the new issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The priority cannot be edited in the new backlog view if the issue does not have a priority previously set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import issues without a priority, through CSV or any other mean.
# Access the Backlog view of the project, and try to set up a priority:
 !backlog-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
- The priority is properly set:
 !priority-set.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It's not possible to set up a priority. You got an error saying *The value could not be saved*:
 !priority-error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- The problem does not occur if you set the priority through the full issue view.
- Also, the problem is noticed in the new Jira issue view. If the new Jira issue view is disabled, the priority field cannot be edited when you click on it:
 !issue-view-off.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Access the issue directly and edit it to set up a priority.
fields.summary: The priority cannot be edited in the backlog view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian - 7th May 2021}
Hi everyone

Work has begun on global time tracking settings! This ticket is a priority for our team and we are working hard to fix the global settings page for time tracking. 

Make sure to watch this ticket for updates on our progress

Regards,
Atlassian
{panel}
h3. 
Summary

The _New issue view_ does not respect the global settings for time tracking. If one chooses the _Time display format_ as *hours* in _Global Settings_, _New Issue View_ will still show it in *Pretty* format (weeks, days, hours)
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to _Global Settings_ → _Time Tracking_ and set _Time display format_ as *hours*
 # Create a Scrum project, an issue in that project and log some work (more than 10 hours)
 # From the _Board View_ click on one issue to open it in the _New Issue View_

h3. Expected Results

The _Time Tracking_ section in the view should show the time logged in hours, as defined in the global settings
h3. Actual Results

The _Time Tracking_ section in the view shows the time logged in weeks, days, hours, minutes (_Pretty view_)
h3. Workaround

There is no direct workaround. One can click on the issue key in order to open it in a separate page where the _Time Tracking_ section uses the global setting
fields.summary: New issue view should respect global settings for time tracking

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Mac
 * Safari version 11.1.2 (13605.3.8)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the new issue view
 # Set IME to a Japanese one
 # Type two letters (Consonant + Vowel) and press the Enter key to convert in the comment field or description field
 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).

h3. Expected Results

"k" + "i" is converted to "き" ("ki" = "き" in Japanese) and the cursor remains on the same line
h3. Actual Results

"k" + "i" is converted to "き" ("ki" = "き" in Japanese) but a line break is automatically inserted
h3. Notes

Converting is mandatory when entering Japanese. Though users can use other browsers/IMEs, this is affecting Japanese users badly

log for investigation
||OS||Safari||Firefox||Chrome||IE||
|Mac|y|n|n|N/A|
|Windows|N/A|n|n|n|
h3. Workaround
 * Use other browsers
 * Switch back to the old view using the steps provided in [The new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]:
{quote}To turn the new issue view on or off in Jira Software projects for now, head to *Your profile and settings* (!https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/files/952598546/952598547/1/1528762082768/person.png|height=18!) > *Personal settings* and toggle the switch for the _New Jira issue view_.{quote}
fields.summary: Unnecessary line break inserted when typing Japanese characters with Mac+Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some non-ascii characters represented as [digraphs|http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/digraph.html] in import file are causing intermittent failures to import files in Jira. We've had similar problems in the past:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65035

However, the behavior has changed.

Strangely enough, some imports work. Some characters that seem to cause problem: {{^H}}, {{^L}} and {{^[}} (check documentation mentioned above).

A similar bug exists, with a different error message:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68795

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Jira instance
# Add a project/issue and create a new comment
# Copy some text with one of the broken characters and paste it on the comment
#* If using Mac, to copy it:
#** Open a text file in vi in terminal
#** Go to insert mode (click i)
#** Click CTRL + V followed by CTRL + <character> (e.g. if you want {{^H}}, <character> is h)
#** Save file
#** Run pbcopy < <filename>
#** This will copy the content of file to your clipboard with the character
# Save the comment
# Export a backup
# Re-import it (it can be to the same site)

h3. Expected Results
The import always works.


h3. Actual Results
The import intermittently fails with this error:
{noformat}
fetch-provisioning-state failed: A JiraImportCompletionRequest holds the lock for jira: workflowId=d7513c62-8d76-4546-b157-800e114ce7cc, runId=22BMcbZ9O9l94msoAU/I8EAZWIavR2Sms3iaqxkuKwjd0= - io.atlassian.cloudprovisioner.swf2.state.ConflictPermanentActivityException: A JiraImportCompletionRequest holds the lock for jira: workflowId=d7513c62-8d76-4546-b157-800e114ce7cc, runId=22BMcbZ9O9l94msoAU/I8EAZWIavR2Sms3iaqxkuKwjd0= at io.atlassian.cloudprovisioner.swf2.state.LockedWorkflowsStateManager.raiseUnableToLockException(LockedWorkflowsStateManager.java:292) at io.atlassian.cloudprovisioner.swf2.state.LockedWorkflowsStateManager.lambda$applyWaitsThenFailForAnyScopeConflicts$13(LockedWorkflowsStateManager.java:241) at java.util.HashMap.forEach(HashMap.java:1289) at io.atlassian.cloudprovisioner.swf2.state.LockedWorkflowsStateManager.applyWaitsThenFailForAnyScopeConflicts(LockedWorkflowsStateManager.java:239) at io.atlassian.cloudprovisioner.swf2.state.LockedWorkflowsStateManager.l...
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
Clean the {{entities.xml}} file by running this comment in vi:
{code}
:%s/[\x01-\x1f]//g
{code}

Or use any other tool that removes non-ASCII characters.
fields.summary: Non-ASCII characters (digraphs) intermittently break import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The CSV import does not work when trying to clear an existing issue resolution.
As the import work to set a resolution on any issue it should work the other way as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test project and a test issue
# Set a resolution to the issue
# Import a CSV like the following:
{noformat}
Key,Summary,Resolution
TEST-1,Test,Unresolved
{noformat}
# Select the mapping option for the resolution field
# At the mapping page use the "Import as blank" option which should refer to the un-set resolution:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 18.39.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The import should finish and the issue TEST-1 have its resolution cleared.

h3. Actual Results

The import finishes and the resolution is not cleared for the issue.

h3.Workaround

Use the [HowTo: Bulk Clear Resolution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/howto-bulk-clear-resolution-635896313.html] KB and clear the resolution through a transition.
fields.summary: CSV import can't clear an issue resolution

fields.description:
If the JIRA user's personal setting is using a latin or cyrillic language as the user's language preference, the External System Importer CSV option is not working, it will show a message about "_inactive users within JIRA that need to be activated to process the import and ask to grant Global JIRA Users Permissions to the following CSV users before trying again to process the import_". However, once this message is showed, the *Next* button will be greyed after uploading the file or after clicking anywhere (reproduced it for french, spanish, italian, portuguese). 
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.08.12.png|width=151,height=123,thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.08.23.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.50.17 copy.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.09.10.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.06.51.png|thumbnail! 
 Also, choosing *None of these* instead of *CSV* works as a workaround as *the None option redirect to the CSV importer but without facing this bug*. The CSV option works as expected with all the other languages settled within the personal settings. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 12.50.17.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 11.52.09.png|thumbnail!

 

Seems similar to another bug [JRACLOUD-69790: CSV External system import in Spanish is not working if uploaded file contains non-ASCII characters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69790], but the file encoding is set to UTF-8 not ASCII, so it's not an encoding inconsistency and it still works using the External System Importer *None of these* option instead of the CSV, which *still redirect to the CSV file importer but without facing this message and this bug*. 

+*Step to reproduce*+
# Go to the *personal setting*
# Choose a latin or cyrillic language (e.g. french / spanish / italian / portuguese)
# Go to System > External System Importer > CSV
# Upload a CSV file

+*Expected Result*+
Able to click *Next* and run a CSV file import.

+*Actual Result*+
*Next* is greyed and the CSV file can't be imported.

+*Workaround*+
- Change the *personal settings* in order to use another language than a latin's one.
- Use the *None of these* option from the External System Importer to run the CSV import.
fields.summary: External System Importer CSV option is not working for all latin or cyrillic languages (french , spanish, portuguesh, italian, russian...) but it still works using the None option instead of CSV

fields.description:
h2. Summary
On create issue dialog when pasting screenshot (or file) from clipboard to description field only text that refers to image is inserted but no actual file is attached to issue.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create issue
# Paste attachments from clipboard
# It displays that the image has been attached but the upload progress bar doesn't show up and doesn't block as it's in progress
# Issue is created and the error that Unable to render embedded object file is displayed

Video:
https://cl.ly/3O2t3r3k3Z2j

h2. Expected Result
It should upload the attachments and block the issue creation while the updload progress doesn't finish and display it on the description as thumbnail

h2. Current Result
It doesn't upload the attachments and the description shows that it can't render the image:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (xxxxx.png) not found.
{code}

Updload the attachment by using the browse option at updload section at issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transition's post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" is no longer working when creating an issue. The security level for new issues is always set as default, regardless of the post-function configuration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add two users to JIRA. For example: *User A, User B*

 # Create a project

 # In the project's *People* add User A to project role *Administrators*, and add User B to project role *Developers*

 # Create a issue security scheme (i.e. Test Security Scheme) with following security levels:

 * 
 ** *Level C (Default)*

 * 
 ** *Level D*

 # Associate this issue security scheme with the project

 # Edit the project's workflow and add the following post-functions to *Create Issue* transition using the post-function *Set issue security level based on user's project role*:

 * 
 ** If user is a member of the *Developers* role, set issue security level to *Level D* (Test Security Scheme).

 * 
 ** If user is a member of the *Administrators* role, set issue security level to *Level C* (Test Security Scheme).

 # Publish the workflow

 # Log in as *User A* (Administrators) and create an issue in the project. For example *Test Issue A*

 # Log in as *User B* (Developers) and create another issue. For example *Test Issue B*

h3. Expected Results
 * The security level for *Test Issue A* be set as *Level C* (as per post-function)

 * The security level for *Test Issue B* be set as *Level D* (as per post-function)

h3. Actual Results
 * The security level for both *Test Issue A* and *Test Issue B* are set as *Level C* 

h3. Workaround (updated)

Refer to Resolution 2 or Resolution 3:
 * [How to set the Security Level of an issue based on group membership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-set-the-security-level-of-an-issue-based-on-group-membership-726565612.html]

*Alternative:*
 # Edit the project's workflow and add the post-functions to the *Create Issue* transition using the post-function *Set issue security level based on user's project role*
 # Move the *set issue security level to based on user's project role field* post function to be on top (step 1) of 'Create Issue Post function'
fields.summary: Create issue transition Post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" is not working

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, there is no way to use Release Dates as a Field or Custom field in Jira without the use of add-ons. 

h3. The request
It would be nice to have a way to use such information in tickets automatically, without having to do it manually issue-by-issue
fields.summary: Allow administrators to use Release Date as a Field, or Custom Field

fields.description:
At my studio we use rich filters to display a variety of information, breaking down the filter types in combination onto different controllers to match categories we want to bundle them into.

 

The one thing that people using these dashboard always get tripped up on is trying to turn on multiple buttons at once and wondering why they do not see any results.

 

Suggested Solutions:

- One fix for this would be to give each individual gadget to have the option of having whether they operate AND or OR ac cross the whole controller.

 

- Another solution would be to allow each static filter to be individually configured to be an AND or an OR when setting it up in the first place.
fields.summary: Rich Filter Controllers are inflexible and only support "AND" style arguments for static filters.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When working with the single line text field, you can easily perform a search agains the issue. However the issue will populate in JQL searches for whatever data the field contained prior to being re-set to EMPTY.
JQL will still filter the issue by the "IS EMPTY" JQL search criterion, however it does show up in a search if it matched previously.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a single-line text custom field.
* ensure that you can easily modify the field on some issues
* on a new issue, populate the new field
* Search using TEXT LIKE operator (~) for what you populated in that field, the issue should show up
* Remove the content in the field from the issue
* Search again

h3. Expected Results
The search will no longer populate with the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The issue will show up in the search results in spite of being Null/EMPTY
 
h3. Notes
none

h3.Workaround
Only workaround known is to filter out by adding "AND CUSTOM_FIELD NOT EMPTY" to your JQL search.
fields.summary: Single-line text custom fields will show in search if value is set to Null

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are creating new Custom Fields that will be associated to All of the Projects in their Instance would like a way to select all Screens rather than having to check each option individually

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a Select All/None option 

h3. Why this is important
Customers may have a Large Number of Custom Screens for Each of their Projects and it is a time consuming task to manually check all options
 
h3. Workaround 
- Manually Check the options
- 3rd Party Browser Extension that allows highlighting Checkbox to mark them
fields.summary: Include Select All/None on Screens Associate Field Page

fields.description:

When trying to create a wallboard slideshow, a Communications Breakdown message is being displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access JIRA dashboard
 # Click on [...] and try to *Set up wallboard slideshow*

h3. Expected Results

A box should be presented for the user set up his slideshow as desired

h3. Actual Results

Communications breakdown message is displayed
 
See attachment.
fields.summary: Unable to set up wallboard slideshow

fields.description:
There should be a feature in the form of a report of JQL function to view what users are searching for in the Basic, Quick or Advanced searches to collect data on how users are using JIRA and most searched for queries.
||Original request||
|I'd like to have a report on what users are searching for in our instance of Jira. Like a search query report or a search history log. What I'm after is to research what people typed into the search field in Jira. I'd like to understand what information, type of ticket or issues users are looking for. It would help me understand what content I need to create that users can re-use without searching and keep asking expensive engineers. Essentially, I'm trying to reduce engineering time spent on troubleshooting by creating content for returning issues and errors. Having the list of search queries would tell me what the recurring searches are. The following data fields would be useful:
 - User name
 - User type
 - Search query (keywords used)
 - Date of search|
fields.summary: Verify what users are searching for in the Search box

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The forward email function in JIRA Incoming Mail handler is used to report on emails that failed to turn into issues, however; when there is a default reporter set, no forward emails are sent out.
h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Default Reporter on Incoming Mail Handler
 # Set Create Users = False
 # Set Forward Email
 # Send email from an email that isn't a member of the instance

h3. Expected Results

Email sent to forward email saying the message can't be processed
h3. Actual Results

No email is sent to forward email


h3. Workaround
Remove Default Reporter
fields.summary: Forward email on Incoming Mail Handler doesn't work if default reporter is set

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When customer is using Kanban board and includes Story points, the issue spans a line, which makes the board more difficult to interpret.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have story-point styled for Kanban projects similar as for Scrum projects.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Story points make Kanban board not as easy to read as in Scrum

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the language is set to a different language other than English, and a user comments on a Jira issue by using Jira Mobile app, the comments section seem distorted and have "threads".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Jira issue.
# Comment on the issue a few times using Jira Mobile App.
# Switch the language to Deutsch.

h3. Expected Results
The comments should be shown correctly without any "threads".
 !expected-english.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The comments will show as if they were threaded comments. The comment will also appear hyperlinked (which is unclickable).
 !actual-deutsch.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* When the comment is collapsed, the comment will disappear. Even after refreshing, the comment will still not be visible, as Jira "remembers" that the user has previously collapsed the comment. A workaround would be to switch to English language temporarily, expand the comments, and revert the language.
 !collapse-broken.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Change the language to English.
fields.summary: Comment section get distorted when commented through Mobile, and language is set to a different language besides English

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-issue-issueIdOrKey-assignee-put] documentation, you should be able to set the assignee via accountId, but doing so does not correctly set it.

*Steps to replicate*
# Create an issue and make sure that it's unassigned
# {{GET /myself}} to get the accountId
# cUrl request:
{code}
curl -X PUT \
  https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/<issue_key>/assignee \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic <basic>' \
  -H 'Cache-Control: no-cache' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ "accountId": "<accountId>" }'
{code}

Expected behavior:
Should be able to update this via accountId
fields.summary: REST API /assignee does not set correctly when using accountId

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The German translation of the "Share" Button recently changed from "Teilen" to "Freigeben". This causes misunderstandings with customers, because the word "Freigeben" is the term for "Approving". In our Change Request Workflow we now have two functions with the same word. 
 Please change it back to "Teilen" or include it in the translations.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Set profile language to German
 # Open a ticket and locate the "Share" button

h3. Expected Results

Share is translated with Teilen
h3. Actual Results

Share is translated with Freigeben
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Incorrect German translation

fields.description:
With Jira V48bfca9e the german translation for the {{In Progress}} status got changed to {{Laufend}} which is a really bad translation for in progress. This should be changed back to {{In Arbeit}} which was the correct translation since ever.

 

P.S.: I know how to change that back for the status in system administration. However, {{Laufend}} is still not the right translation. And the status category is not intended to be translated by system admin.
fields.summary: Rename german translation for In Progress back to In Arbeit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who are searching for a Custom Field with a Contains Operator are noticing invalid results are being returned. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Single-Line Custom Field and make it visible on an Issue
# Add a value to this Single-Line Custom Field (save changes)
# Edit the Issue and clear the Single-Line Custom Field
# Advanced JQL Search for {{"Custom Field" ~ "original value"}}

h3. Expected Results
Issue that had the value is not returned. 

h3. Actual Results
The JQL Advanced for the Custom Field using the Contains Operator finds the old Custom Field Value and returns the Issue in the Search:

 !IssueView.png|thumbnail!  
!JQLSearch.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Database shows no Custom Field Value for the associated Issue
"Where's My Field" indicates that the Field does not have value.

h3.Workaround
Add a non-empty value to the Custom Field
fields.summary: Advanced JQL Search with CustomField Using Contains Operator Returns Invalid Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the e-mail provider Yandex (https://yandex.com/). Jira is not able to verify existing messages, as a result no issues are created or comments added. Also, there are no errors, Jira only states that it found 0 issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an e-mail account at https://mail.yandex.com (allows free account creation).
# Start an IMAP or IMAPS connection with that e-mail account.
# Setup a mail handler
# Send e-mails to your account 
# Check if issue is created or try using the "Test" function.

h3. Expected Results
Issues created or comments added normally.

h3. Actual Results
Jira states that there are 0 messages even when there isn't 

h3. Workaround
Use pop_secure connection
fields.summary: Jira mail handlers are not able to fetch messages when using the e-mail provider "Yandex" with IMAP or IMAPS

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users can view worklogs in their own issues even when they don't have any time tracking permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add log work entries on an issue.
# Remove all the time-tracking permissions for the reporter
# Sign in as the user account and check for the same issues.

h3. Expected Results
The log work entries must not be visible to the reporter for all the issues

h3. Actual Results
The reporter will be able to see the log work entries in the issues
 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Users can view worklogs in their own issues even when they don't have any time tracking permissions

fields.description:
Clicking post functions link on the workflow edit screen opens a new tab with the post functions edit screen, after publishing a draft from there, the workflow edit screen opened in the previous tab becomes unusable.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Open a new workflow draft of an existing workflow
 # Click on some transition arrow
 # Click on the post functions link
 # Edit a post function
 # Publish the draft from this screen
 # Go back to the previous tab with the workflow edit screen
 # Repeat steps 2 and 3
 # Notice the corrupted post functions edit screen
fields.summary: Publishing a workflow draft from the post functions edit screen lead to corruption of the workflow edit screen opened in previous tab
